stem: Which of the following is an X-linked condition?
disc:
Tay-Sachs disease is an autosomal recessive disease caused by a deficiency of the hexosaminidase enzyme. It results in the accumulation of type 2 gangliosides getting accumulated in the brain. Affected children start missing milestones after 6 months of age and gradual deterioration of motor and intellectual will eventually result in death by the age of 5. A cherry red macular spot is a common finding.

Gaucher's disease is the most common lysosomal storage disease which can be treated by enzyme replacement. It is an autosomal recessive disease. Presentation varies with age and usually involves the visceral organs, bones, and bone marrow.

Fabry disease (aka Anderson Fabry disease) is a common lysosomal storage disease. It is an X-linked condition. In its severe form, affected males have severe neuropathic pains, telangiectasia, abdominal pain, corneal opacities, proteinuria, polyuria, and heat and cold intolerance.

Polycystic kidney disease has two forms: autosomal dominant and autosomal recessive.
